name: Lab Environment Aquarium Control System
short_description:
The Horniman Museum and Gardens hosted a Hackathon to challenge the brightest minds in technology with the goal of developing a tailored environmental micro electronic control system for coral research that creates the same temperature, daytime photoperiod and moonlight in the Horniman's aquarium system with the actual temperature and photoperiods found in Suva, Fiji to see if we can replicate the environmental cues to trigger coral spawning right here in the UK.

The Hackathon community directly contributed to the project and this repository holds the results so that other institutions may develop use and test this system.

This software is beta and the authors hold no responsibility for its accuracy or reliability. It is used at your own risk.
